thread.title: Once-wary GOP leaders toast President Trump
thread.title_full: Once-wary GOP leaders toast President Trump

author: Susan Ferrechio
title: Once-wary GOP leaders toast President Trump
text:
House Speaker Paul Ryan and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell offered toasts to President Trump. (AP Photo/Andrew Harnik) Once-wary GOP leaders toast President Trump By Susan Ferrechio ( @susanferrechio ) â€¢ 1/20/17 3:29 PM Susan Ferrechio Chief Congressional Correspondent The Washington Examiner http://s3.amazonaws.com/content.washingtonexaminer.biz/images/static/authors/Ferrechio-3.jpg More 
Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Friday toasted President Trump at the U.S Capitol luncheon following the inauguration, telling the exclusive crowd of dignitaries, "he's been underestimated often but never let it stop him from succeeding." 
McConnell, R-Ky., who once feared Trump's nomination would cost his party the Senate majority, called on Trump to continue his streak. 
"We are wishing him similar success as he turns to the challenge of governing," McConnell said. 
McConnell said Trump's campaign had many of the characteristics that define the nation. 
  
"Big, bold, energetic, enterprising and resilient," McConnell said. "Always looking to the next horizon. It sure sounds like our country and it sure sounds like Donald Trump ." 
Speaker Paul Ryan, R-Wis., delivered a toast for Vice President Mike Pence , a former House lawmaker and GOP leader who is poised to play an outsized role as a conduit between the White House and the GOP-led Congress. Ryan recounted the times they were summoned to the speaker's office as young lawmakers who then bucked their own leadership. 
"There is no one I have served with who brings more belief to his work than Mike Pence ," Ryan said. "No one believes more deeply in our country and our people. He is a happy warrior. The president could not have chosen a better partner for his work than Mike Pence." Top Story
